s3026-118:
To amend the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 to repeal restrictions on offshore wind leasing.

Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,

Section 1. Short title

This Act may be cited as the “Offshore Wind Leasing Repeal Act of 2022”.

Sec. 2. Findings

Congress finds the following:

(1) The United States has the potential to be a global leader in the development of offshore wind energy.

(2) Offshore wind energy can help to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and create jobs in the United States.

(3) The current restrictions on offshore wind leasing are impeding the development of offshore wind energy in the United States.

(4) Repealing the current restrictions on offshore wind leasing would help to promote the development of offshore wind energy in the United States.

Sec. 3. Repeal of restrictions on offshore wind leasing

(a) In general

The Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 is amended--

(1) in section 101(a)(1)(A), by striking ``(A) in general'' and inserting the following:``(A) in general.--Except as provided in subparagraph (B),''; and

(2) by adding at the end the following:``(B) Exception for offshore wind energy.--The Secretary shall not impose any restriction on the leasing of offshore areas for the purpose of developing offshore wind energy.''.

Sec. 4. Authorization of appropriations

There are authorized to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary to carry out this Act.
s3025-118:
To amend the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 to repeal restrictions on onshore wind and solar.

Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,

Section 1. Short title

This Act may be cited as the “Repeal of Restrictions on Onshore Wind and Solar Act of 2023”.

Sec. 2. Findings

Congress finds the following:

(1) The United States has a long history of leadership in the development of renewable energy technologies.

(2) Onshore wind and solar power are two of the most cost-effective and reliable sources of renewable energy available.

(3) The current restrictions on onshore wind and solar development are unnecessary and counterproductive.

(4) Repealing these restrictions would create jobs, boost economic growth, and help the United States achieve its climate goals.

Sec. 3. Repeal of restrictions

(a) In general

The Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 is amended--

(1) in section 101(a)(1)(A), by striking ``and'' at the end;

(2) in section 101(a)(1)(B), by striking the period at the end and inserting ``; and''; and

(3) by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

``(C) onshore wind and solar power facilities.''.

(b) Conforming amendment

Section 102(a) of the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 is amended by striking ``and'' at the end of paragraph (1), by striking the period at the end of paragraph (2) and inserting ``; and'', and by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

``(3) onshore wind and solar power facilities.''.

Sec. 4. Authorization of appropriations

There are authorized to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary to carry out this Act.
